sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; import CommonBanner from "../../../common/banner/CommonBanner"; import Footer from "../../../common/footer/Footer"; import Header from "../../../common/header/Header"; import InfoSection from "../../../common/infoSection/InfoSection"; class DevOps extends React.Component { render() { return ( <>
Devops

BrainHR offers comprehensive DevOps services to its clients. Our DevOps toolset includes various software and tools like Jenkins, Artifactory, SonarQube, Checkmarx, GitHub, XLR, Chef, Splunk, Confluence, Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry, Spring Framework, GIT, Maven, and advanced branching strategies. We work cross-functionally to provide automation frameworks and drive improvements in various areas such as patching, machine-managed certificates, security vulnerability management, and pipeline enforced test automation. We define and execute a program strategy to advance program-level CI/CD and infrastructure build automation capabilities, streamlining application release processes, and paving a path towards immutable compute.

We use Git which is a version control system used for software development, Jenkins which is a popular automation server used for continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) tool used for automating the software build and deployment process, and Docker which is a containerization platform used for building and deploying applications. Our team of experts can also help businesses with DevOps integration and customization, using tools like Ansible which is a popular automation tool used for infrastructure provisioning and configuration management, and Kubernetes which is a popular container orchestration platform used for managing containerized applications.

BrainHR specializes in creating and maintaining infrastructure for applications in Azure using Terraform. We also build and automate CI/CD pipelines for various applications, integrating Jenkins with various DevOps tools such as Artifactory, SonarQube, Checkmarx, GitHub, XLR, Chef, Splunk, Confluence, and more. We work cross-functionally to provide automation frameworks to drive improvements in various spaces such as patching, machine-managed certificates, security vulnerability management, and pipeline-enforced test automation. We define and execute against a program strategy for advancing program level CICD and infrastructure build automation capabilities to streamline application release processes and pave a path towards immutable compute.

Our team has extensive experience building cookbooks/recipes/plans to automate provisioning of physical and virtual hosts, as well as operational run activities. We have a strong understanding of various PaaS and Container Orchestration Systems such as Cloud Foundry (PCF) and Kubernetes, Spring Framework and experience in deployment automation concepts and tooling including Jenkins, Artifactory, GIT, Maven, and advanced branching strategies. We work with a global team spread across tech hubs in multiple geographies and time zones. Our team has a strong understanding of Linux VMs and Cloud-Based VMs and experience with troubleshooting build issues during the Jenkins build process along with deploying and supporting applications using Chef Infra and Chef Habitat and have good knowledge and experience with setting up monitoring and alerting dashboards on Splunk and Dynatrace.

BrainHR provides DevOps services that primarily focus on cloud-based infrastructures and systems. The services include Azure services such as AD, Synapse, SQL databases, and PowerBI, among others, to create service principals that connect different resources. Azure AD is used to add users to different groups and provide access to certain resources. BrainHR also creates resources on Azure using Azure DevOps and manages repos and pipelines on different environments while creating new terraform scripts. Additionally, we manage and store new secrets, provide different levels of access policies to users, groups, and service principals on Azure Key vaults, and manage users, namespaces, nodes, and pods for different projects on Redhat Openshift.

Moreover, we manage releases, updates, and bug fixes with Dev and QA teams using AWS, Ansible, Git, Docker, and Kubernetes. We design the application layer of the product with EC2, RDS, and elastic cache, configure AWS cloud watch, and create cloud formation templates to deploy new infrastructure. BrainHR also migrates log data files from data center to AWS using Snowball and MigrationHub and sets up DNS using route53 on EC2 instances with specific DNS record types. We create IAM users, groups, and assign them custom policies and roles and configure firewall security groups on EC2s and Network Access Control list on VPCs.

We automate backups on AWS using snapshots and automated backups scheduled using cron, creates elastic block storages to mount on EC2s to increase storage and performance, and uses Docker to containerize and deploy web applications for microservices. We create clusters, nodes, and pods using OpenShift and support the infrastructure, change management at infra level, and upgrade and patching major rollout OpenShift capacity planning. Furthermore, BrainHR uses Kubernetes to orchestrate the deployment, scaling, and management of Docker Containers, and sets up a NGINX web server on Kubernetes with a load balancer service for an external IP. We also perform vulnerability testing with nmap and other tools using Ansible and resolve issues.

BrainHR utilizes Jenkins to deploy CI/CD and troubleshoot any failures through console logs, performs network troubleshooting related to TCP/IP, ethernet performance, NIC tuning, routing, subnets gateway, and monitors CPU, memory, physical disk, Hardware and Software RAID, multipath, file systems, and network using tools such as Nagios. We also create a bash script to monitor specific resources as in CPU, Memory, Swap Space, I/O stats and work with Docker for convenient environment setup for development and testing on Q/A, PROD. We provide DevOps support services including 24/7 monitoring and management of DevOps systems and processes, troubleshooting and problem resolution, and continuous optimization and improvement of DevOps processes.

BrainHR leverages Google Cloud Platform (GCP) for its DevOps infrastructure. The GCP services used include Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Google Cloud Build, Google Cloud Storage, Google Cloud SQL, and Google Cloud Functions. These services are used to create and manage infrastructure as code, automate CI/CD pipelines, and deploy applications to production environments. In addition, BrainHR uses DevOps tools such as Jenkins, Artifactory, SonarQube, Checkmarx, GitHub, XLR, Chef, Splunk, Confluence, and Dynatrace, which are integrated with GCP services to support different programming languages such as Java, Node.js, Python, Visual Studio, Groovy, and Go. Our team works cross-functionally to provide automation frameworks for patching, machine-managed certificates, security vulnerability management, and pipeline-enforced test automation. We also focus on advancing program-level CI/CD and infrastructure build automation capabilities to streamline application release processes.

According to a recent report by Grand View Research, the global DevOps market size is expected to reach USD 12.85 billion by 2025, growing at a CAGR of 18.6% during the forecast period. This highlights the growing trend towards the adoption of DevOps practices in businesses across various industries. With BrainHR DevOps Services, you can be confident that you are partnering with a service provider that has the expertise and experience to help you achieve your goals and drive innovation in your organization.

); } } export default DevOps;
